name: proteomicslfq-lfq-quant
title: Label-Free Quantitative Proteomics
description: Comprehensive DIA/DDA label-free proteomics quantification workflow from raw mass spectrometry data. Performs database searching, FDR filtering, protein inference, and statistical analysis with MSstats. Samplesheet format: `sample,raw_file`
content:
ProteomicsLFQ - Label-Free Quantitative Proteomics

End-to-end bioinformatics pipeline for label-free quantification (LFQ) proteomics analysis. Converts raw mass spectrometry data through database searching, identification, quantification, and statistical analysis to identify differentially abundant proteins across experimental conditions.

What is Label-Free Proteomics?

ProteomicsLFQ enables comprehensive protein quantification without chemical labeling, providing cost-effective analysis of protein expression changes across samples through advanced spectral counting and feature-based quantification methods.

Key Features

  • Complete Workflow: Raw data to statistical results
  • Multiple Search Engines: Flexible database searching
  • FDR Control: Stringent false discovery rate filtering
  • Protein Inference: Resolve shared peptides
  • PTM Localization: Phospho-site mapping
  • Statistical Analysis: MSstats integration
  • Quality Control: PTXQC comprehensive metrics

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Data Conversion: Convert raw data to indexed mzML format
  2. Database Search: Identify peptides with search engines
  3. Re-scoring: Percolator for improved identifications
  4. FDR Filtering: Apply false discovery rate thresholds
  5. PTM Localization: Modification site assignment (e.g., phospho)
  6. Protein Inference: Group peptides to proteins
  7. Quantification: Spectral counting and feature-based methods
  8. Statistical Processing: MSstats differential analysis
  9. Quality Control: PTXQC comprehensive reporting

Scientific Applications

  • Proteomics Research: Comprehensive protein profiling
  • Biomarker Discovery: Identify disease markers
  • Drug Response: Characterize treatment effects
  • Systems Biology: Protein network analysis
  • Post-Translational Modifications: Phosphoproteomics

Quantification Methods

  • Spectral Counting: Count identified spectra per protein
  • Feature Alignment: Match features across samples
  • Feature Integration: Quantify chromatographic peaks
  • Match Between Runs: Transfer identifications
  • Intensity-Based: Use precursor ion intensities

Advantages

  • No Labeling Required: Cost-effective approach
  • Unlimited Samples: No multiplexing constraints
  • Comprehensive: Full proteome coverage
  • Reproducible: Containerized workflow
  • Statistical Power: Integrated MSstats analysis

Input Requirements

  • Raw Mass Spec Data: Vendor format or mzML
  • FASTA Database: Protein sequence database
  • Sample Sheet: Experimental design and metadata
  • Optional: Custom modifications and parameters

Main Outputs

  • Protein Quantifications: Abundance matrices across samples
  • Differential Analysis: Statistical comparison results
  • Peptide Identifications: Sequence-level data
  • PTM Sites: Localized modifications
  • QC Reports: PTXQC and MultiQC summaries
  • Visualization: Volcano plots and heatmaps

Perfect for: Proteomics • Mass Spectrometry • Biomarker Discovery • Drug Response • Systems Biology
